1. Local raw materials: 1a) Low use-lives, with knapping strategies characterised by manufacture, use and discard
2. Non-local raw materials: 2a) Majority of formal tools, in the case of individual provisioning or higher use-lives, with knapping strategies characterised by the manufacture, use and maintenance

1. Local raw materials: 1b) Decreased reduction, larger cores and debitage, lower blank-to-core ratio
2. Non-local raw materials: 2b) Increased reduction, smaller cores and debitage, higher blank-to-core ratio

1. Local raw materials: 1c) Decreased tool reworking, low presence of retouch and/or tool maintenance, and lower tool-to-debitage ratio
2. Non-local raw materials: 2c) Increased tool reworking, high presence of retouch and/or tool maintenance, and higher tool-to-debitage ratio
2d) Lower tool diversity, characterised by less specialised tools
